definition: to think deeply/to ponder
to think/to consider
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
to act without taking time to think (idiom); to react instantly/to fire from the hip
see 不假思索[bu4 jia3 si1 suo3]
to think oneself to exhaustion (idiom)

sentences.english: Silence. Mulan stared out of the window deep in thought.
sentences.chinese: 穆蘭沉默着，盯着窗外思索着。

sentences.english: Ever looked up at the night sky and wondered: What is up there?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾仰望夜空，思索着上面到底有什麼？

sentences.english: Confusion isn’t a bad thing. It means you’re growing and thinking.
sentences.chinese: 困惑不見得是壞事，那表示你在思索和成長。

sentences.english: He handed it out without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 他不假思索的把它交了上去。

sentences.english: Accumulations, rous 'd love and joy and thought.
sentences.chinese: 那些積聚，被勾起的愛和歡樂，以及思索。

sentences.english: The student spent almost an hour trying to puzzle out the meaning of this difficult sentence.
sentences.chinese: 這個學生花了近一個小時思索出這難句的意思。

sentences.english: He that can read an meditate will not find his evenings long or life tedious.
sentences.chinese: 會讀書思索的人不會感到長夜無聊或生活乏味。

sentences.english: He sat there-ting on his misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那兒思索着自己不幸的事。

sentences.english: Think about how you can minimize user input.
sentences.chinese: 思索如何能讓用戶輸入最小化。

sentences.english: Because this it came to me in a moment , form my own head .
sentences.chinese: 因爲這是從我自己頭腦裏不加思索地出來了。

sentences.english: We will have to reconsider the whole thing.
sentences.chinese: 那統統我們將沒有能沒有重新甲笤思索。

sentences.english: After mulling it finally decided to restore as a hobby.
sentences.chinese: 幾番思索之後終於決定再次還原自己的愛好。

sentences.english: The room ponders the possible significance of this.
sentences.chinese: 整個屋子都在思索這其中的意義。

sentences.english: I pondered this sentence painfully, after he was gone.
sentences.chinese: 在他走後，我苦苦地思索着這句話。

sentences.english: People have speculated about human cognition for 2000 years.
sentences.chinese: 人們對人類的認知力已思索了2000年。

sentences.english: She acted in an off-hand way.

definition: to contemplate/to ponder/contemplation/meditation
to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
to reckon/to consider/to turn over in one's mind
to ponder/to consider
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
to think sth through/to consider carefully
to mutter to oneself irresolutely
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to hesitate
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to consider/to ponder
to hesitate
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
a good while/a long time
to plot/to scheme/to calculate
looking pensive/thoughtfully
